body:
One possibility for capturing the name of a module is to add it to the module in both [`__setattr__`](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/nn/modules/module.py#L323-L328) and [`add_module`](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/nn/modules/module.py#L111-L121). 
So you'd do something like (in `add_module`):
```python
module._name = name
self._modules[name] = module
```
Maybe it's not necessary to add a new attribute to the module, and we can use the names in `self._modules` directly.

On an unrelated note, it's a pity that `__setattr__` doesn't call `add_module` internally I think, but well, that's for another discussion.
